com.centurylink.mdw.services.pooling

Class PooledAdapterConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.centurylink.mdw.services.pooling.PooledConnection
      • com.centurylink.mdw.services.pooling.PooledAdapterConnection

  • public class PooledAdapterConnection
extends PooledConnection
    An instance of this class represents a connection in a connection pool. From the connection to the external systems point of view, the pooled connections can implement one of the two styles: a) one-connection-for-all: keep the same connection for all usage. For this style, the connection is opened when the pooled connection is created, and the connection is closed when the pooled connection is destroyed. b) one-connection-per-call: create a connection on each call. In this style, the invoke() method here invokes openConnection() and closeConnection() of the adapter around its invoke() method.

    • Method Detail

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Specified by:
        destroy in class PooledConnection

      • returnConnection

        public final void returnConnection(int exceptionCode)
        This is used in the client code using the connection. You must invoke this method when the call is finished, to return the connection to the pool. It is recommended to put this call in the "finally" arm of a "try" construct that get the connection, to ensure the connection is always returned.

      • invoke

        public java.lang.String invoke(java.lang.String message,

        Parameters:

        metainfo - per-call meta data such as correlation ID
        Returns:
        Throws:
        ConnectionException - when there is a retriable error
        AdapterException - when there is a non-retriable error

      • ping

        protected boolean ping()
        This method is used for auto-shutdown and restart.
        Returns:
        true if the connection is up, and false if it is still down.
